thread.title_full: Food and Tour News: Oysters in New York, Wine and Jambalaya in Maine - The New York Times

author: Shivani Vora
title: Food and Tour News: Oysters in New York, Wine and Jambalaya in Maine
text:
Our morning travel news digest, with deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.
IN NEW YORK, OYSTERS ON THE FARM AND PLATE
The Midtown Manhattan seafood restaurant the Sea Fire Grill is giving diners a chance to see where its bivalves come from by offering an expedition to Sexton Oysters in West Islip, N.Y.
The Sea Fireâ€™s executive chef, Ted Pryor, will lead the half-day trip, which takes place on Saturday, Oct. 17, and includes transportation in a luxury minibus to Sexton. Once they reach the farm, participants will take a 20-minute boat ride to the area in the water where they are harvested and learn about the different varieties.
An oyster lunch back in the city follows the visit. Mr. Pryor and his team will serve a five-course menu with dishes like roasted halibut in an oyster saffron sauce. The food will be paired with cocktails like mimosas as well as wine.
The restaurant plans to introduce more trips to Sexton Oysters based on interest.
